title.narrative: Envelope1: Provision of essential health care services at Al Dana Maternity and Pediatric Hospital

description.narrative:
The proposed project aims to enhance the access to critical life-saving and life-sustaining primary and secondary healthcare services to the vulnerable internally displaced persons (IDPs) and host communities in Idleb Governorate, Harim District, Dana Sub-district, which is performed through supporting the provision of comprehensive Sexual and Reproductive Health (SRH), Child Health services in Al Dana Maternity Hospital (HeRAMS code: G0703154! Dana Maternal Hospital), and integrated nutrition services to pregnant and lactating women (PLW) and children under 5 and community health services to nearby camps and schools surrounding the hospital. SAMS prioritizes assisting the most vulnerable groups, mainly women and with special attention to children at schools, and is proposing to support both CEmONC and child health services in the pre-existing Al Dana Maternity Hospital, which is equipped with trained medical staff and medical equipment for labor and delivery rooms, operating rooms, in-patient, and neonatal care to meet the needs in Al Dana sub-district, and which had been identified as a priority by the Health Cluster, and the Sexual and Reproductive Health Technical Working Group (SRH TWG), where according to the SRH TWG activity dashboard Dana Hospital is the highest in 2021 in newborns with 6502 deliveries.
Over the project period, SAMS will financially support the medical and non-medical staff salaries in addition to the facility’s running costs, medical commodities, minor maintenance and rehabilitation, and any other needed materials, while the staff will be supported with technical training, mentorship, and supervision. Moreover, through the integrated nutrition services, SAMS will continue to target the acute needs of malnutrition screening for PLW and children, and outreach teams will conduct community health services linked with camps, formal and informal settlements and schools in the catchment area.
Al Dana Maternity Hospital includes in-patient wards which include 17 beds in the gynecology department, 32 beds and 9 incubators in the pediatric department, a newborn Intensive care unit which includes 4 incubators, 1 PICU bed, one blood bank, and two ER departments (pediatric and gynecology) while the outpatient services will include a gynecological clinic, family planning clinic, GP clinic,, pediatric clinic, and nutrition clinic.
SAMS will be able to reach a total of 47,100 beneficiaries (around 5% of them are PWD) 100 men, 21,538 women, 13,073 girls, and 12,389 boys.
